parts:
You are extracting a UBX protocol message definition from u-blox PDF manual pages.

TARGET MESSAGE: UBX-NAV-SAT
Expected IDs: class_id=0x01, message_id=0x35

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Extract ONLY the message named "UBX-NAV-SAT". Ignore any other messages visible.
2. Set the "message_type" JSON field based on the "Type" row in the message header table:
   - "Type: Input" → message_type: "input"
   - "Type: Output" → message_type: "output"  
   - "Type: Periodic" → message_type: "periodic"
   - "Type: Polled" → message_type: "polled"
   - "Type: Command" → message_type: "command"
   - "Type: Set" → message_type: "set"
   - "Type: Get" → message_type: "get"
   - Combinations like "Periodic/Polled" → message_type: "periodic_polled"
3. The payload table shows fields in order. Extract them exactly as shown with correct byte offsets.
4. Verify field sizes match offset differences (e.g., if offset jumps by 4, field is 4 bytes).

FIELD EXTRACTION:
- byte_offset: Exact byte offset from "Offset" column (integer, 0-indexed)
- data_type: UBX types: U1, I1, X1, U2, I2, X2, U4, I4, X4, R4, R8, CH
- For arrays: {"array_of": "U1", "count": N} - check Type column for "[N]" or "x N"
- scale: Include "raw" string and numeric "multiplier" if shown
- unit: Physical unit if shown (ms, deg, m/s, etc.)
- reserved: Set true for reserved fields
- fixed_value: For "type" fields at offset 0 (especially MGA messages), if the description
  says "Message type (0x01 for this type)", set fixed_value to the integer (e.g., 1).
  This value identifies the specific message variant.

PAYLOAD LENGTH:
- Fixed: {"fixed": 28}
- Variable: {"variable": {"base": 8, "formula": "8 + N*12"}}

QUALITY CHECK before returning:
- Byte offsets sequential and non-overlapping
- Field sizes match offset gaps
- Total field sizes match payload length


Return the extracted message using the ubx_message_extraction tool.

fields.name: iTOW
fields.description: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See section iTOW timestamps in the integration manual for details.

fields.name: gnssId
fields.description: GNSS identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

fields.name: svId
fields.description: Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

fields.name: elev
fields.description: Elevation (range: +/-90), unknown if out of range

fields.name: azim
fields.description: Azimuth (range 0-360), unknown if elevation is out of range

values.description: code and carrier locked and time synchronized
code and carrier locked and time synchronized
code and carrier locked and time synchronized

bitmask_fields.name: svUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = Signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers is currently being used for navigation

bitmask_fields.name: diffCorr
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = differential correction data is available for this SV

values.description: no orbit information is available for this SV

bitmask_fields.name: ephAvail
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = ephemeris is available for this SV

bitmask_fields.name: almAvail
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = almanac is available for this SV

bitmask_fields.name: anoAvail
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = AssistNow Offline data is available for this SV

bitmask_fields.name: aopAvail
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = AssistNow Autonomous data is available for this SV

bitmask_fields.name: sbasCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = SBAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: rtcmCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = RTCM corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: slasCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = QZSS SLAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: spartnCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = SPARTN corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: prCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = Pseudorange corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: crCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = Carrier range corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: doCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = Range rate (Doppler) corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

bitmask_fields.name: clasCorrUsed
bitmask_fields.description: 1 = CLAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers
